page.title: 01INTRODUCTION
page.content: This is an area of gently rolling hills,mainly used as farmland.Barley is grown extensively,and some wheat. Much of the grassland is cut and turned into silage or hay for the winter feeding of herds of Friesian cattle. The largest village is Scorton ,set around a raised green,and there are smaller settlements at Whitwell,the Forest and Bolton-on-Swale.The main buildings in Scorton incude St.John of God's Hospital,the Grammar School,two shops and the Institute. Close to the River Swale are large deposits of gravel.The quarries near Ellerton are now closed and the resulting lakes are used by fishermen and as sanctuaries for wild birds,but gravel is still being extracted from the Scorton quarries.
